ccre.chan

Class FloatStatus

  • java.lang.Object
    • ccre.chan.FloatStatus
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    FloatInput, FloatInputPoll, FloatInputProducer, FloatOutput, FloatTuner

    public class FloatStatus
extends java.lang.Object
implements FloatOutput, FloatInput, FloatTuner
    A virtual node that is both a FloatOutput and a FloatInput. You can modify its value, read its value, and subscribe to changes in its value. FloatStatus also provides a number of useful helper functions. By convention, most float inputs and outputs have states that range from -1.0f to 1.0f.

      boolean optimizeEqualValues

    • Field Detail

      • value

        protected float value
        The current state of this FloatStatus. Do not directly modify this field. Use the writeValue method instead. By convention, most float inputs and outputs have states that range from -1.0f to 1.0f.
        See Also:
        writeValue(float)

      • hasBeenModified

        public boolean hasBeenModified
        Has this FloatStatus been modified since this flag was last cleared?

      • consumers

        protected CArrayList<FloatOutput> consumers
        The list of all the FloatOutputs to modify when this FloatStatus changes value.
        See Also:
        addTarget(ccre.chan.FloatOutput), removeTarget(ccre.chan.FloatOutput)

      • optimizeEqualValues

        public boolean optimizeEqualValues
        By default, setting a FloatStatus to the same value that it already has will have no effect. However, in the case of certain Watchdog setups, this may be unwanted because it would prevent the Watchdog from being fed by the value changing. Set this field to false to pass through all values instead of just changes.

    • Constructor Detail

      • FloatStatus

        public FloatStatus()
        Create a new FloatStatus.

      • FloatStatus

        public FloatStatus(FloatOutput target)
        Create a new FloatStatus that automatically updates the specified FloatOutput with the current state of this FloatStatus. This is the same as creating a new FloatStatus and then adding the FloatOutput as a target.
        Parameters:
        target - The FloatOutput to automatically update.
        See Also:
        addTarget(ccre.chan.FloatOutput)

      • FloatStatus

        public FloatStatus(FloatOutput... targets)
        Create a new FloatStatus that automatically updates all of the specified FloatOutputs with the current state of this FloatStatus. This is the same as creating a new FloatStatus and then adding all of the FloatOutputs as targets.
        Parameters:
        targets - The FloatOutputs to automatically update.
        See Also:
        addTarget(ccre.chan.FloatOutput)

      • addTarget

        public void addTarget(FloatOutput csm)
        Description copied from interface: FloatInputProducer
        Subscribe to changes in this float input's value. The float output will be modified whenever the value of this input changes. By convention, most float inputs and outputs have states that range from -1.0f to 1.0f. If available, the current value of the input will be written at this time.
        Specified by:
        addTarget in interface FloatInputProducer
        Parameters:
        csm - The float output to notify when the value changes.
        See Also:
        FloatOutput.writeValue(float), FloatInputProducer.removeTarget(ccre.chan.FloatOutput)

      • removeTarget

        public boolean removeTarget(FloatOutput consum)
        Description copied from interface: FloatInputProducer
        Unsubscribe from changes in this float input's value. This reverses the actions of a previous addTarget call. By convention, most float inputs and outputs have states that range from -1.0f to 1.0f.
        Specified by:
        removeTarget in interface FloatInputProducer
        Parameters:
        consum - The output to unsubscribe.
        Returns:
        Whether the output was actually subscribed.
        See Also:
        FloatInputProducer.addTarget(ccre.chan.FloatOutput)

        Specified by:
        getAutomaticChannel in interface FloatTuner
        Returns:
        the automatic tuning channel or null if none exists.
